title: Rittō Station
text:
is a passenger <a href="railway%20station">railway station</a> located in the city of <a href="Ritt%C5%8D%2C%20Shiga">Rittō</a>, <a href="Shiga%20Prefecture">Shiga Prefecture</a>, Japan, operated by the <a href="West%20Japan%20Railway%20Company">West Japan Railway Company</a> (JR West).
Lines.
Rittō Station is served by the <a href="Biwako%20Line">Biwako Line</a> portion of the <a href="T%C5%8Dkaid%C5%8D%20Main%20Line">Tōkaidō Main Line</a>, and is 43.2 kilometers from and 489.1 kilometers from .
Station layout.
The station consists of two opposed <a href="side%20platform">side platform</a>s connected by an elevated concourse. The station is staffed.
History.
Rittō Station was opened on March 16, 1991.
Passenger statistics.
In fiscal 2019, the station was used by an average of 11,976 passengers daily (boarding passengers only).
